title: Home
text:
Quantifying Our Planet: Open-Source Solutions for Terrain & Environment
    
      TEQS (Terrain and Environment Quantification Systems) 
      works on high-resolution geospatial analysis, environmental monitoring, 
      and AI-driven decision-making.
    
    
      Explore Projects
      View on GitHub
    
  




  
    
    
      
        Open Collaboration
        TEQS is fully open-source, welcoming community-driven contributions.
      
      
        AI-Powered
        Leverage GNNs, transformer models, and HPC pipelines for next-gen analytics.

title: Projects
text:
A robust data ingestion and HPC orchestration engine for spatiotemporal datasets, supporting multi-cloud and on-premises clusters.



Suite of AI modules, including transformer-based pipelines, graph neural networks (GNNs), time-series analysis, and multi-modal sensor fusion for large-scale environmental monitoring.



Interactive 3D terrain rendering, AR/VR overlays, and NeRF-based (Neural Radiance Fields) integration for immersive environment reconstructions.




TEQS-IoT for edge-based data collection

TEQS-Cloud for serverless HPC pipelines, etc.

title: About TEQS
text:
Our mission is to develop open-source, cutting-edge systems for high-fidelity terrain and environment analysis, leveraging transformer-based geospatial pipelines, multi-modal data fusion, and HPC integrations.



TEQS was inspired by leading arXiv research on remote sensing, foundation models, and advanced machine learning approaches for environmental data.



Our core team spans environmental scientists, ML engineers, and HPC experts, collaborating with academic institutions and open-source communities worldwide.
